title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
section: In 2022, a government in a country introduced a forest conservation tax. The main purpose of the tax is to charge for activities like logging, land clearing, and timber exports to discourage unsustainable use of forests.
text: In 2022, a government in a country introduced a forest conservation tax. The main purpose of the tax is to charge for activities like logging, land clearing, and timber exports to discourage unsustainable use of forests.

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
section: In 2022, a government in a country introduced a forest conservation tax. The main purpose of the tax is to charge for activities like logging, land clearing, and timber exports to discourage unsustainable use of forests.
text:
In 2022, a government in a country introduced a forest conservation tax. The main purpose of the tax is to charge for activities like logging, land clearing, and timber exports to discourage unsustainable use of forests.
To assess the effectiveness of the Forest Conservation Tax introduced in 2022, the government consults two managers to understand its impact.

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text:
Primary Data vs Secondary Data

Primary Data: Data collected directly by the researcher for a specific purpose or study.
Secondary Data: Data that has already been collected by someone else and made readily available for researchers to use

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text:
Primary Data Collection Methods

Observational studies
Questionnaire Survey

Method: Asking a set of questions
Instruments:

Printed or digital questionnaires
Google Forms / SurveyMonkey
Mobile apps or data collection tools (e.g., KoboToolbox)

Your turn: Find other primary data collection methods.

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text:
Your turn
Identify secondary data sources relevant to forestry and environmental sciences.

Open source data repositories:
ourworldindata
Paid data repositories

title: EMF 115 1.0 Key Skills for Resource Managers (Statistics, Data Science and Statistical Programming)
text:
This session, conducted under the unit EMF 115 1.0, is designed to equip future resource managers with essential skills in statistics, data science, and statistical programming.
Through hands-on learning with R, students will develop the ability to collect, manage, analyze, and visualize data relevant to environmental and resource management contexts.
Students are introduced to practical data science workflows, including data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, visualization, and introduction to statistics and machine learning models, all contextualized within environmental and forestry applications.

title: Pre-lecture Work: Tasks to Complete Before the Lecture
text:
R is an open-source software that we use for statistical computing, data analysis, and visualization. On Thursday, 17 July 2025, we will explore key statistical, data analysis, and data science skills that resource managers should be aware of.
Please complete the following tasks before attending the lecture:

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: Pie chart

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: Histogram

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: Histogram

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: Scatterplot

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text:
Interpretations





r_value
interpretation




r = 1
Perfect positive linear correlation


1 > r ‚â• 0.8
Strong positive linear correlation


0.8 > r ‚â• 0.4
Moderate positive linear correlation


0.4 > r > 0
Weak positive linear correlation


r = 0
No correlation


0 > r ‚â• -0.4
Weak negative linear correlation


-0.4 > r ‚â• -0.8
Moderate negative linear correlation


-0.8 > r > -1
Strong negative linear correlation


r = -1
Perfect negative linear correlation

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text:
AI as a code assistant
Use ggplot2 to create a scatter plot of flipper_length_mm and body_mass_g in the dataset penguins. Write the R code.

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins)

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g))

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g)) + geom_point()

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g)) + geom_smooth(se=FALSE)

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g)) + geom_smooth(se=FALSE) + geom_point()

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g)) + geom_smooth(method="lm", se=FALSE)

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g)) + geom_smooth(method="lm", se=FALSE) + geom_point()

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g, col=species)) + geom_smooth(method="lm", se=FALSE) + geom_point()

title: Key Skills in  Statistics,  Data Science,  and Statistical Programming  for Resource Managers
text: ggplot(data=penguins, aes(x=flipper_length_mm, y=body_mass_g, col=species)) + geom_smooth(method="lm", se=FALSE) + geom_point(size=3)
